entry.title: A day before USACO Open
entry.content:
I was considering not to write this blog post since it could affect my feelings, leading to a worse performance tomorrow.

This post isn‚Äôt really that much about USACO and competitive programming though, since the only thing I‚Äôve done was being anxious.

CMIMC

And then there‚Äôs CMIMC. The trip was a fun experience overall (this was actually the first travel competition I‚Äôve ever attended). On Friday our plane got delayed so we had lunch at like 4. Then we went to play frisbee and later went to estimathon (we won!).

The Theoretical Computer Science round was kind of interesting because I‚Äôve never done one of these rounds before (except for practicing in math team). But it turned out that we didn‚Äôt do too good on that round either despite me being a USACO main. On team the only thing I did was p1 and solving p2 at the last second but not having enough time to change our wrong answer.

During individuals I ABSOLUTELY SOLD (distribution was strictly less than 434 oops). I probably should‚Äôve been in Lexington Epsilon. I can‚Äôt really say anything though since CMIMC (and perhaps math in general) isn‚Äôt as important as USACO is to me or USA(J)MO is to other people, so I probably shouldn‚Äôt be ranting too much.

On our way back my seat was changed for some reason, making me sit with a stranger instead of Lexington people. The wifi also didn‚Äôt work on our way back, so I basically just idled for an hour.

Other

Obviously my 226.5 JMO index was lower than the 233.5 cutoff, but since I wasn‚Äôt prepared anyway and would spend more time on preparing for USACO, I don‚Äôt really feel too bad about that. I also probably got a 10 in F=ma (got p1, p4, p6, p8, p9, p10, p11, and guessed the rest), which is much lower than a 15 so I don‚Äôt have anything to regret about.

There was also picoCTF and vyx7 & other LexMACS people admitted orz (33th place in US High School or below). In the beginning of the window I just stole all the easy problems and pretended that I contributed. I‚Äôll (probably) also become one of the LIT organizers which means that I probably can‚Äôt participate in LIT 2024 standard round even if it somehow miraculously happens.

Unfortunately, my GPA fell off so now I likely won‚Äôt have one higher than 4.1 anymore.

The only thing I can hope for now is to not do bad in USACO Open, hopefully a 300+ (or even 400+) score. I don‚Äôt want all my luck in December, January and February to be for nothing.

My birthday also passed recently, so now I‚Äôm 15 years old.
entry.summary: I was considering not to write this blog post since it could affect my feelings, leading to a worse performance tomorrow.

entry.title: USACO February Plat
entry.content:
Camp when?

Score: 494, the distribution was 333 / 56 / 105

The contest went pretty well, perhaps even better than the January contest. I quickly (in the first 30 minutes) got the main observation for problem 1. Although I proceeded to spend 1 hour on implementation, I just felt confident that I could pull a >400 score again with the 2.5 hours remaining.

So I was pretty calm and relaxed and got 494 with 1 hour remaining. Maybe some parts of me thought this was good enough, while some other parts of me still thought I should try to full solve another problem, since this would probably be enough to make it to the leaderboard.

I just thought p2 was probably actually easy and it had a lot of subtasks that could hopefully get me to a >500 score so I spent the remaining hour doing p2 and got 0 points. But I guess this was fine since I still don‚Äôt think I would‚Äôve gotten p3 anyway.

I feel the style of platinum contests, or perhaps even gold, have changed a lot. At least noticably there hasn‚Äôt been as much graph problems (0 in plat, not sure how many in gold), and the problems are more ad-hoc in general. Perhaps this benefits me since I‚Äôm probably an ad-hoc main, but this would probably mean that even if I somehow make USACO camp, I would still have to rely on this kind of different style to perform well.

Hopefully I don‚Äôt throw USACO Open along with my camp chances üôè People say an average of >300 should make but I don‚Äôt know how much more USACO open is weighted so it‚Äôs a little scary. Why isn‚Äôt the cutoffs for camp disclosed üò≠.

I also hope USACO could let us know our rank within people in the United States who took the contest (maybe certified). Last time I got 421, which was apparently a very common score, and it was rank 49. I have no idea how this converts to the rank in the United States (or perhaps if we limit it to certified people).

Reposting manifold market
https://manifold.markets/C0DET1GER/will-i-make-usaco-camp-in-2025?play=true

My manifold net worth tripled in February which was ‚Ä¶ nice?

entry.title: AIME II 2025
entry.content:
because we had a snow day

Some Stuff

Originally we were going to take aime i but because of snow day we had to take aime ii. This may be kind of good because historically aime ii has lower cutoffs (and I don‚Äôt feel the tests are harder). But maybe this time cracked regions are taking aime ii which will inflate the cutoffs idk.

So I had aime ii and f=ma on the same day (f=ma was delayed to like 5:45-7:00), which probably didn‚Äôt make that much of a difference since there‚Äôs no way I could‚Äôve gotten >=14 in f=ma. (I‚Äôm just bad like that)

I didn‚Äôt really expect anything to be honest. Like of course my goal is to make jmo, but I knew that it‚Äôs not that likely considering how I would‚Äôve thrown both AMCs if not because I was lucky (and still didn‚Äôt get 140+ for AMC 10A, but I guess 136.5 is fine). Also that I haven‚Äôt been doing that much math lately since my main objective is to make usaco camp I guess (impossible)

In last year‚Äôs aime, I sillied (maybe some of them don‚Äôt really count as sillies) my way from 8 to 5, giving me like a 170 index. That‚Äôs why I didn‚Äôt really expect myself to make jmo, and maybe that turned out to be the right mindset, since I wasn‚Äôt too nervous before / during the test.

AIME

For p1, in the beginning my lengths were all wrong because I kept misreading the letters in the lenghts. But at least I finally managed to solve it after like 7 minutes. Then I did p2-4 in the next 15 minutes and found out there‚Äôs two geo in a row.

I kind of wanted to skip both since I‚Äôm a geo antimain and I didn‚Äôt want the geos to give me emotional damage for the entire test. But then I remembered that it‚Äôs just p5 and p6 which will hopefully not be too hard. So I spent 20 more minutes and did both.

Then I just kind of skimmed through the next 5 problems and found that 4 / maybe 5 of them were combo which somehow boosted my confidence. And they turned out not to be too hard so I got 7, 8, 9, and 11 in the next 30 minutes or so (I didn‚Äôt know how to p10 because all I could think of was a 16 * 8 * 3 dp skull)

So now I had 105 minutes left and did 10 problems, but I thought the ten I did were easy so I probably needed more if I wanted to get lucky and make jmo. I didn‚Äôt really spend a lot of time on p12 and p14 because geo. So I started trying to do p13.

Then I suddenly wanted to go to the bathroom but somehow thought that I had to submit early if I wanted to go so I held it for 30 minutes. Until I figured I should actually ask and turned out I could go without submitting early üíÄ (and this submitting early rule probably only applied to my elementary school exams). Going to the bathroom earlier probably wouldn‚Äôt have made a difference though since I was trying to do p13 the entire time.

I kind of wanted to do more problems, but then thought a 236.5 would likely be enough to qualify for jmo, but that also meant I needed 0 sillies which is impossible. So I went to check my work and caught 4 sillies (p4 multiply by 1/3 instead of 3, p5 I did multiplication wrong, p9‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt know what to say it‚Äôs just entirely wrong, and p11 I had 95 because I forgot about numbers that weren‚Äôt divisors of 24)

This was satisfying, but also extremely terrifying at the same time. This meant my aime score would‚Äôve been like 4 points lower (at least I thought it would be 4 points lower). These 40 minutes of checking really made a big difference.

Then I proceeded to think about p10 since it‚Äôs the only combo problem left. Got it in about 10 minutes, and I immediately checked and caught a silly. Spent about 5 more minutes and found that I only had 10 minutes left so I couldn‚Äôt really do anything. Well, I checked my work but didn‚Äôt find any more sillies.

Reflection

so distribution was like
11111 11011 00000 (got p8 and p11 wrong)

For p8 I forgot that 55 existed so I wrote 800 üò≠ I wouldn‚Äôt count that as a silly but idk
For p11 I remembered that 8 was 0 the first time but then completely forgot that it was 0 when I was correcting it üíÄ

So my jmo index went from 246.5 to 226.5

Definitely not optimal, but considering that I didn‚Äôt even anticipate jmo, this was better than I thought. But perhaps qualifying or not wouldn‚Äôt matter that much either, since I‚Äôm bad at proofs and stuff ‚Äì> will probably get like a 0 on jmo anyway and flagged a cheater

And I might‚Äôve been cooked in F=ma, we don‚Äôt talk about that

entry.title: USACO 2025 January
entry.content:
Spoiler: I got a positive score üëç

Score: 421 (distribution is like 333 / 26 / 62)

I think I performed okay in this contest, at first I thought that 421 was pretty good but turned out it‚Äôs probably because p1 was very very easy (I thought so too). The thing is I worshipped CodeTiger before contest and got one problem, so surely if I worshipped a bit more I would‚Äôve gotten 2‚Ä¶

But the thing is many people unfortunately skipped p1 in the beginning (like me). I only went back to look at p1 (and solve it after like 30 minutes) because I was so desparate with my sub 100 score.

I still don‚Äôt know why I didn‚Äôt get subtask 2 for problem 2 though, will probably have to wait until sunday when they release the testcases and stuff to find out. I made the right observation, but still couldn‚Äôt manage to solve even the subtask üò≠

I hope to camp this year, although that seems pretty much impossible considering my skill. But I‚Äôve heard that they considered improvement arcs so hopefully 767 in gold ‚Äì> 421 in plat is good enough. I guess I‚Äôll have to get lucky in two more contests, or maybe get extremely lucky in open.

MITIT also happened recently, we were CodeTiger ORZ ORZ ORZ so we got first in hs beginner and second in overall beginner. Kind of sold for not being able to do p8 and p9, but a 900 isn‚Äôt really that different from a 735 as long as we got first place I guess

Also just realized that AIME is next week, and I forgot to do any OTIS üíÄ

And I made a manifold market lol
https://manifold.markets/C0DET1GER/will-i-make-usaco-camp-in-2025?play=true
buy no for free mana.
entry.summary: Spoiler: I got a positive score üëç

entry.title: Virtual - BOI 2024
entry.content:
Unfortunately, due to certain circumstances, this will be the last blog of this year.

Basically I decided that I should actually be productive during the christmas break. I also virtualed a USACO plat contest, paken 2023 day 1, paken 2023 day 3, and JOI 2023 but I‚Äôm kinda too lazy to write so many blogs.

Day 1

Tasks here

Virtual

spoiler

After reading all the problems, pA felt kind of dp-ish, pB‚Äôs probably some weird geometry stuff which I‚Äôm really bad at, and pC was probably also some kind of dp + perhaps BIT, but I could only think of the O(N^2) sol atp.

Estimated difficulty: C < A << B, so I tried to solve C first.

In problem C I kept aiming for some O(NlogN) solution but then after a few minutes I finally figured out the O(NsqrtN) solution.

0:35 C 58

Passing all subtasks except for the O(N^2) one was very absurd, so I wondered whether it was a modulo issue

0:37 C 100

That was nice.

Before dumping a potential 4 hours into problem A, I thought I shouldn‚Äôt make the same mistake as TOI 2024 (only aiming for full scores instead of subtasks, which only gave me a score of 200/500 in the end)

Therefore, I looked at subtask 1 in pB and guessed that the answer was the rectangle area minus 1

0:49 B 0

whoops, maybe that guess was wrong then
I then drew a few cases by hand and found out that I overthought and the answer was actually -1

0:53 B 1

At least I passed the subtask, although 1 point isn‚Äôt really any better than 0

Then after drawing a few more cases I made an ‚Äúeducated guess‚Äù (without proof because I‚Äôm bad at geo / linear alg / whatever) that the answer for subtask 3 is (gcd of differences in x) times (gcd of differnces in y).

1:04 B 10

Oh wait there isn‚Äôt Ëá™ÂãïËÅØÈõÜ ??? (automated subtask union or whatever that‚Äôs called in english, honestly i don‚Äôt know)

1:05 B 11

Well, I tried my best, at least I probably wouldn‚Äôt regret not spending more time on this problem afterwards, so I started thinking about pA.

I mindsolved subtask 1, and subtasks 2 and 3 could be done with some priority_queue. I decided to implement subtasks 2 and 3 first.

2:14 A 0

Just some kind of out-of-bounds error

2:21 A 29

I then went back to implement subtask 1

2:25 B 40

Currently my score is 40 / 11 / 100

Despite how I said ‚ÄúI spent enough time on pB‚Äù, I still felt that 11 points was way too low, so I threw pA aside temporarily (which turned out to be a very good decision)

After drawing out a few more cases, I guessed again that the answer for subtask 2 was (the triangle area formed by the three points) * 2

2:49 B 11

I forgot that when the triangle area is 0 I‚Äôm supposed to output -1

2:55 B 21

I then went on guessing that by combining subtasks 2 and 3, the answer is 2 * (gcd of all triangle areas). I tried proving it, but failed miserably

3:01 B 50

How were almost all my guesses correct? I then decided to use some randomization to pass subtask 5 (because I forgot that I could actually fix one point in the triangle)

3:07 B 65

This gave me some hope and I tried using some better (?) randomizations, trying to obtain the full score and failed (I thought the official solution would involve randomization smh)

65 was probably decent enough anyway, so I decided to spend the rest of the time on pA. I came up with the solution for subtask 4 but there was like 998244353 bugs in my code.

4:34 A 69

And I spent the remainder of the time doing essentially nothing.

Reflection

spoiler

Final score: 69 / 65 / 100
Total: 234
Day 1 rank 5

This is much higher than what I should‚Äôve gotten, at least my score would‚Äôve been 170 without guessing

Also less people solved pA than I originally thought, and scores generally aren‚Äôt that high on pB. I guess I should improve my math though, otherwise my score would probably have been pretty low.

Also I should be better at implementation üíÄ I wasted a lot of time on debugging, especially pA (I didn‚Äôt include all my submission scores since then the blog would be even longer)

Day 2

Tasks here

After Day 1 I actually gained a bit of confidence in my poor OI ability, maybe perhaps too much

Virtual

spoiler

The entire problemset just felt harder than day 1 for some reason (although it turned out that a great amount of people performed better on day 2 than day 1) The only thing I could think of was the O(N^2) solution for pA (40 pts). The implementation for pB seemed cancerous, and I didn‚Äôt have any idea for pC.

I made a few WA submissions

0:50 A 40

Then it turned out that subtask 4 wasn‚Äôt that hard

0:53 A 53

I was really afraid that I would end up with a sub-100 score, so I still decided to move on and try pB. Subtask 1 (4 pts) was just a rectangle, but I read the problem incorrectly and originally thought the problem was asking for the number of squares one can put in the rectangle.

1:14 B 4

Subtask 2 seemed like a lot of casework but I decided to try it anyway. Wasted like an hour and got 0 points so I moved on.

For pC, subtask 1 was just enumeration, and later came up with the solution for subtask 5

2:29 C 20

Then I went back to problem B subtask 2 since I thought nothing could‚Äôve gone wrong. I couldn‚Äôt figure out anything until at the three hour mark when I found that I actually MISREAD THE PROBLEM üò≠

3:05 B 13

My current score is 53 + 13 + 20 = 86. I might actually get a sub-100 score if things continue like this. At the same time (3 hours), my day 1 score was above 200, which is very depressing

At least I was sure I finally understood the problem correctly, and found out that subtask 3 was actually quite similar to subtask 2.

3:20 B 24

I then spent some more time on a solution for subtask 5 which turned out to be wrong, leaving me with less than 1.5 hours left. I found out that I probably spent less than 30 minutes on pC so I went back and came up with the solution for subtasks 1-3.

4:13 C 56

This problem is the only one (in day 2) where my submissions don‚Äôt repeat their scores. My score is finally higher than 100 (133), but is still pretty low imo. The solution for subtask 4 (14 pts) is also very similar but perhaps a bit harder to implement. Soon, I also figured out how I could obtain the remaining 47 points for pA.

Now I have like 40 minutes left, and I can probably decide to do pA (perhaps more risky?) or pC. Upon contemplation, I made the worst choice possible: try to solve pB.

Why? Maybe I‚Äôm inexperienced in OI. Maybe I‚Äôm greedy and think that 40 minutes is still plenty of time left. Maybe I just thought I could get lucky like day 1 and get a lot of points by guessing. Anyway, I wasted more time to get 0 points on pB until I found it was probably too late to implement (and finish debugging from past experience) the full solution for pA.

4:44 A Compilation Error

This was so weird (and maybe funny). My code in xcode ran perfectly, and I don‚Äôt know what I was thinking but didn‚Äôt look at the error message and instead stared at my code for errors.

4:51 A 53

Then I couldn‚Äôt find the bug until the end of the contest.

5:02 A 74

Turned out I forgot to add 1 somewhere. Well, too bad, the contest ended already. An extra 21 points wouldn‚Äôt have made me gold anyway.

Reflection

spoiler

Final score: 53 / 24 / 56
Total: 133
Day 2 rank 17

This was actually so bad. I also didn‚Äôt expect so many people to perform better in day 2 compared to day 1. My maximum score in day 2 across all problems is lower than the minimum in day 1 üíÄ

I think the main problem was that I spent most of the time trying pB without even getting a lot of points. Perhaps I should‚Äôve given up earlier and worked on pA and pC instead.

My luck on day 1 might‚Äôve actually destroyed my day 2 performance, since it was because of how my guess obtained so many points that made me willing to spend time and guess wrong solutions on day 2 as well.

Also I made a lot more submissions than listed in the blog, and by a lot I mean

There‚Äôs no penalty, so it doesn‚Äôt matter ‚Ä¶ right?

I totally regret the decision I made when there was 40 minutes left, I don‚Äôt know where the confidence came from that made me think I could get all 64 points in like 20 minutes.

Perhaps I‚Äôm not good at CP after all.

Final Results

spoiler

Total: 367
Overall rank: 9 (high silver?)

Wasn‚Äôt any close to gold anyway, would‚Äôve needed all 67 points. My score on pB was really kind of low despite I tried for more than 3 hours probably.

I never learn the lesson. I shouldn‚Äôt get stuck on one single problem. Hopefully I can at least be happy with my performance in the next USACO in January.

Doing OI virtuals is somewhat fun though ngl, but unfortunately I‚Äôm very bad at these. Perhaps doing more virtual contests would help me come up with some kind of optimal contest strategy? Or maybe what I should do at each weird scenarios? idk actually, and idt I have that much time after semester 1 ends (4 less study blocks üò≠)
entry.summary: Unfortunately, due to certain circumstances, this will be the last blog of this year.

entry.title: USACO Plat yayy
entry.content:
nicee!!!

Turns out 716 qualified for plat (cutoff is 700 this time). Only 20 promotions in USA which seems pretty much unexpected, but still pretty happy about it.

I need to lock in during the Christmas break or I‚Äôll likely get a 0 in plat sadge

entry.title: USACO December oops
entry.content:
I did not underperform, it‚Äôs just my skill issue.

Still not much to say really, still sad

Score: 716 (333 / 50 / 333 distrib)

I feel that I‚Äôm probably not promoting tbh

Basically I looked at all three problems first then figured that p3 seems to be pretty well known and I might‚Äôve even solved it before. Then I spent like 40 minutes on trying some random greedy that did not work. Then I decided to go look at the other problems.

First p1. I looked at the subtasks and thought that it could do with sqrt and wrote some kind of Nsqrt(N)log^2(N)-ish solution (I thought that there‚Äôs only one log because I suck at time complexity, which was also why I decided to implement it). It only failed three testcases. I moved on because three testcases didn‚Äôt really seem to matter right now.

This was about at the 1 hour mark since I passed (most of) p1 relatively quickly. Then I looked at p2 and had no idea. I thought of dp for subtask 2 but nothing beyond that. I decided that ‚Äúp3 must actually be very easy‚Äù and put 2 more additional hours on that problem. I just started having random ideas and found out that greedy actually worked. It‚Äôs a rather short implementation so I ACed the problem at around the 3 hour mark.

At this time my score was about 600, and I figured that the 3 testcases might actually matter. (At this point I still didn‚Äôt notice that my time complexity had two logs) I thought that it must‚Äôve been a constant problem, so I removed the ‚Äúdefine int long long‚Äù and other unnecessary code to pass all testcases.

I had 666 points, and since p1 and p3 seemed to be relatively easy (although I had a skill issue and spent 3 hours on them), I thought the cutoff would be around 800. This also meant that I would have to solve subtask 3 in the remaining hour. This didn‚Äôt seem too bad, but I thought I should solve subtasks 1 and 2 first to secure a score above 700. Then, since I had a significant skill issue I spent about 30 minutes to solve those subtasks after I had the idea for dp (the main thing was that my solution was different and implementation heavy I guess).

Then I just spent the remaining 30 minutes thinking about how to solve subtask 3 and not solving it (which is essentially doing nothing)

After the contest, people seem to say that the cutoff will be around 750. I hope that the cutoff is 700, although it seems realistically impossible ngl.

Still hope that the cutoff is 700 (or lower) ü•∫ I still want a chance to camp in 9th grade, even if it‚Äôs 0.000000001%

I also learned that I‚Äôm not the only CF master clowning in USACO gold
entry.summary: I did not underperform, it‚Äôs just my skill issue.

entry.title: Mid December Update
entry.content:
found that I haven‚Äôt posted for a long time, although there‚Äôs probably like only one person reading this (myself)

Oh well there isn‚Äôt much to say so I guess I won‚Äôt make any subtitles

Basically I did get DHR in 10A (and did not in 10B), which is probably the only thing I‚Äôm happy about recently. Totally threw in BMT, and I don‚Äôt seem prepared myself for USACO. I also might be cooked in Literature üíÄ

And NHSPC (a Taiwanese contest for high schoolers) also happened recently, @the_researching_pooh @69manweiwei @leolin orz

Finally, hopefully I get lucky enough tomorrow and advance into Platinum :) I don‚Äôt know why but advancing really seems so hard and impossible to me, I can‚Äôt even AK when I look at past problems now. And LMT is also happening tomorrow, but because it clashes with USACO certified period I‚Äôm not going, sad
entry.summary: found that I haven‚Äôt posted for a long time, although there‚Äôs probably like only one person reading this (myself)

entry.title: Quarter 1 Recap
entry.content:
writing now although quarter 1 ended on 11/8

Social

Alright seems that the ‚Äúnot socializing with homeroom people‚Äù strategy is not working out smh

I don‚Äôt know whether this is normal but I only have one person in my homeroom I share science with, and zero in all other classes (excluding PE). I also barely share studies with people in my homeroom.

Another thing is that our male-female ratio is like 1:2, and I‚Äôm not the type of person that talks with girls a lot, which makes things even worse.

Other classes are much better though than homeroom imo, at least I talk to people.

CP

I didn‚Äôt really do CP a lot this quarter, I guess I will fall back to specialist on CF soon.

I haven‚Äôt really done any contests recently after I reached master, maybe just one AtCoder contest and an HSCSA contest. I feel I should practice more OI though, I haven‚Äôt practiced a lot and will probably throw OI contests for not getting any partials.

Also LIT is currently indefinitely postponed, so I might fail my C1 goal miserably ü§° Hopefully it will eventually happen, although I might still not get first in middle school division because I‚Äôm bad.

Academics

Not too bad I guess.

In the beginning my grades were bad for Earth Science but it went back up later after all the tests and other stuff. On the contrary, my humanities (Literature + Social Studies) grades gradually dropped as the quarter passed. At least I successfully kept my GPA above 4.

Current GPA: 4.13, might still change though since grades are not final until like 11/18. I‚Äôm pretty glad that my teachers aren‚Äôt too harsh on grading.

Math

I feel there‚Äôs much more math contests here, and math team people are very orz.

A good thing about LHS I guess is that there‚Äôs a lot of orz people and I can learn from them instead of having to do everything myself. Also that I can be carried in contests like HMMT which feels very nice.

The tryouts went out nicely for me, at least I didn‚Äôt silly too much, which placed me in teams that may be higher than my capability. I‚Äôll try my best not to do nothing I guess.

I originally thought that math team had meetings too often, but because of the half days and all the breaks it turns out not to be that many.

And I kind of stopped doing OTIS after school started which is bad, I‚Äôve completed 2 units after the summer break and only 2 units after school started. I‚Äôm currently like level 31 and I don‚Äôt know how good that is.

btw I‚Äôm not trying to say anything is a scam or something

entry.title: HMMT
entry.content:
yayy

I‚Äôm in Lex Gamma, and I‚Äôm probably the only person in the team (or maybe among everyone in LHS that came to HMMT this year) that has never competed in HMMT. Everyone in the team is way better than me tho, so I‚Äôm ready to be carried in team and guts round and drag the team down in individual rounds.

General Round

I did problems 1-6 and 8 and didn‚Äôt even look at the other problems. They announced the answers right after the test ended and I got 3 and 6 wrong which is like sad. I felt soo good when I remembered about the ‚Äú15‚Äù case for problem 6 and thought that many people would probably forget about that one, but turned out that I forgot about the 195 case so I was like one off. I wouldn‚Äôt call that a silly though, as it‚Äôs my own skill issue, but I probably lost like 6 points because of this. At least I found the right pattern in problem 8 which is not too bad.

Theme Round

0 sillies in this round, but still bad

I only looked at 1-7, and 9 (because it‚Äôs combo) and didn‚Äôt know how to do 6 because I‚Äôm bad at geo. Turned out I spent too much time on 9, and didn‚Äôt really do it the right way. Although I solved 6 problems my distrib is like very bad, so I‚Äôm probably the lowest in the team.

Team Round

tnag carry orz

I probably didn‚Äôt do anything, except p1 p4 and maybe p8, which other teammates could probably have done quickly without me. We (tnag) also perfed teamround with like 5 or 10 minutes left which was nice. We ended up turning it in 30 seconds early maybe for bragging purposes, idk

And they posted the solutions on the HMMT website immediately after the teamround ended, and we ended up not sillying anything and getting a perfect score, tnag orz

Guts Round

alright this is when I really did absolutely nothing

We started pretty good in the first seven sets (perfect score on each), but we were a bit slow so we had to rush through the rest of the sets and unfortunately got 0 points in estimation. Still rank 10 which is like good compared to our scores in individual rounds lol.

Other

tnag went to int bee finals, tnag orz

I also went to both Friday night and the Sunday lectures because it‚Äôs my first time. On Friday I went to HackHMMT and unexpectedly met CorzdeTiger and Sunday stuff were interesting I guess?

Estimates

G 21.153, T 23.242, Total 44.395
G rk. 60, T rk. 60, Total rk. 70
I sold so bad :(
Let‚Äôs see how good an estimate of my score this is. I probably failed the M2 goal miserably

Aftermath

I turned out to be not too bad at predicting?

Results:
G 20.153, T 24.242, Total 44.395
G rk. 89, T rk. 44, Total rk. 65

Kinda happy that I did have something in top 50 but also kinda sad for being that close to top 50 in general and overall (well it‚Äôs not actually that close, but I just felt I was so dumb for forgetting about the 195 case)

At least I‚Äôve finally achieved one of my goals.

entry.title: 2024 AMC 10A
entry.content:
oops, although I guess it‚Äôs not too bad (LONG RANT WARNING)

Before

I was like kinda nervous, because even though this wasn‚Äôt my first time taking the AMCs (actually 10th time), it‚Äôs the first time I‚Äôm taking it digitally, and I‚Äôm afraid that I would mess up. I probably had to be extra careful as I thought it‚Äôs easier to misclick something and ruin my entire test.

Last time I wasn‚Äôt rlly satisfied with my score (120 on an extremely easy test), so I don‚Äôt want to have bad time management again. I also hope that my AMC10 scores won‚Äôt be like my AMC8 ones (strictly decreasing arithmetic sequence). I sillied so bad in the past (4 sillies on AMC8 after reviewing my answers !!!)

The test (?)

So although I was a bit nervous, I tried to tell myself to stay calm, that there‚Äôs always a 10B and I had little chances to get into JMO anyway. Still, I didn‚Äôt expect the Commons I (where we took the AMC10 in LHS) to be that crowded, which somehow made me even more anxious.

I originally wanted to use some kind of strategy like starting from the middle so that I would feel more confident, but then thought that would be worse as I might not even be able to solve those problems :(

I spent like 2 minutes solving p1 because I was so afraid I might silly the first problem. Then I looked at p2, and this was when all the disaster started.

I stared at the problem for 1 minute, trying to understand it, and finally understood it. But I was afraid that I would silly on the second problem, so I subtracted the two from each other and was stuck because I thought 300 / 0.3 = 100 üíÄ

Then I was stuck for another 5 minutes

I decided that I shouldn‚Äôt be stuck on a problem for too long, so I moved on. But after doing every 5 problems, I was like ‚Äúit‚Äôs impossible that p2 was so hard‚Äù and went back to get stuck for another 3 minutes. I felt so desperate when I couldn‚Äôt even do problem 2 when I was aiming for DHR, and couldn‚Äôt stay calm even though I tried to, until I found out that I solved 16 problems and there was 15 minutes left.

I briefly counted and found that I could only get a 109.5 (without any sillies), and I might really get a lower score than last year. Based on past experiences, I on average had 3 sillies per AMC, so I might not even make AIME üíÄ

I expected myself to panick even more after realizing this, but perhaps it‚Äôs that the problems later were easier, I did 18-22 pretty quickly, and also found my mistake in p2. In the last few minutes, I knew that I didn‚Äôt really have time to check my answers, so I only made sure that I didn‚Äôt click on the wrong option on the computer.

After

I didn‚Äôt really check my answers with others since the digital version scrambled the questions and answer choices so that it‚Äôs harder to cheat (and I didn‚Äôt notice for a while). I knew I probably got a really bad score, considering that I could easily calculate wrong when I‚Äôm nervous. Anyways there‚Äôs still a B so hopefully I get a better score on that one :<

===== Above was written before I knew the answers (and scores) =====

So turns out that I didn‚Äôt have any sillies, giving me a 136.5 (18 higher than expected). It‚Äôs still not a very good score considering people saying that this year‚Äôs test was also easy like last year, but enough to make me happy I guess. This is probably my first AMC without sillies, which is ironic as people on AoPS said that this was the most silliable test ever.

My distrib: 11111 11111 11111 11111 11bbb

By this time I‚Äôve also finished taking 10B but I probably won‚Äôt write a blog about it because I‚Äôm lazy and I did very bad despite it‚Äôs much easier than 10A imo.

Hopefully 136.5 is enough to get DHR, MAA didn‚Äôt release the statistics this time so I dont really know, sad.
entry.summary: oops, although I guess it‚Äôs not too bad (LONG RANT WARNING)

entry.title: Goals for 24-25 School Year
entry.content:
Seems a bit too late, but whatever

Many people had been posting about their goals for the school year, so I guess I‚Äôll make one too? So here are my goals, the goals in each category are rougly sorted by difficulty

Legend:

  • ‚úî = successful
  • üìà = currently successful
  • ‚ùì = nothing yet
  • üìâ currently failing
  • ‚ùå = already failed

CP (C)

  • First Place in LIT Standard Round MS Division ‚ùì
  • CF maintain stable 2100+ by end of year üìà
  • AtCoder 1900+ üìâ
  • CF Peak IM üìâ

USACO (U)

  • Plat ‚úî
  • Plat by december ‚úî
  • Get a positive score on each USACO plat contest ‚ùå
  • Camp ‚ùì

Math (M)

  • AMC 10 DHR ‚úî
  • Get individual top 50 in something in HMMT November ‚úî
  • Reach level 50 in OTIS üìâ
  • JMO qual ‚ùì

Other (O)

  • Top 500 on CF contribution leaderboard üìâ
  • GPA 4.0+ üìà
  • Stop being lazy üìâ
  • Socialize üìâ

Difficulty order (in my opinion)

C1 < U1 < M1 < C2 < O1 < U2 < M2 < O2 < M3 < U3 < C3 < C4 < M4 < O3 < U4 < O4

I‚Äôm new here so idk what math contests they have and their difficulty rlly

Also I‚Äôm known for being bad at estimating difficulties of goals (I thought getting into USACO plat was way easier than reaching master on CF üò≠)

Hopefully I can complete maybe 10 of the goals, tho everything above C4 seems impossible to me and I‚Äôm very good at sillying and being dumb
entry.summary: Seems a bit too late, but whatever
